point_drop.text: This is not nothing. This is a point in space.
A point at (0, 0, 0) is the origin, a local center from which all other positions are understood.
Moving a point does not destroy its essence; it transforms its relationships.
Point = (x, y, z) where x is width, y is height, and z is depth.
Worlds are built through points linking together into lines, triangles and stories.

line_drop.text: A line is the shortest path between two points.
Yet it extends without end - infinite in both directions.
The distance between points defines the relationship's span: {length}m right now.
Lines create edges, boundaries, and bridges - defining inside, outside, together, and apart.
From lines come polygons, from polygons come surfaces - connection builds complexity.
Every line you form is a tangible record of collaboration in this space.

triangle_drop.text: A triangle is a polygon with three corners and three sides.
The smallest surface, a skin stretched across relation.
It is stability, the first body that resists collapse.
From triangles all surfaces emerge. The triangle is the seed of every form.
